CHAPTER 7-1 
FIREWORKS 
 
 
7-1-1  
 
REGULATION OF FIREWORKS 
Fireworks are hereby regulated for the preservation of the public peace, mental health, 
and safety of the community.  Unless authorized by a Permit issued by the City, public 
discharge of fireworks within the City: 
 
 
 
 
A. 
Is permitted within the city limits of Brandon on July 3rd and July 4th 
from 10am - 11pm.  Permitted fireworks are specific class 1.4G 
fireworks which include any and all fireworks that are purchased from 
a licensed South Dakota Fireworks retail store. 
B. 
May not occur on any public sidewalk, street, alleyway, or property. 
C. 
May not occur on any private property without the expressed 
knowledge and permission of the property owner. 
D. 
May not occur whenever the Mayor, Police Chief, or City 
Administrator issues a complete ban on any use due to dry climatic 
conditions or other such emergencies. 
 
A Permit for other discharge of fireworks may be issued by the City Council to 
individuals, groups or organizations for organized, public fireworks displays, based upon 
such terms and conditions as established by the City Council. 
 
 
 
 
Legislative History:  
 
 
Authority: 
 
 
 
Ordinance #131, 5/18/84. 
 
 
SDCL Ch. 9-3 generally.

Ordinance #572, 1/1/19 
 
 
 
Election, 6/16/20 
 
 
7-1-2  
 
VIOLATIONS 
Any person who has been found to have discharged fireworks or found to have unlawful 
fireworks discharged from their residence in violation of this ordinance shall be subject to 
a fine of $250 per violation. In addition, the City of Brandon Police Department may 
immediately prohibit further discharge of any firework and may confiscate any firework 
from the violator.
